poem:
"Of Wealth and Women"

In London's heart, ambition's song blends,
With softer notes, an older tale mends.
Proud women on a quest of gold,
While echoes of bygone struggle hold.
In the hum of equality, a songbird's blend, 
Yet, in whispered dreams, of richer men to tend.
Swallowed in paradox, their truth descends,
A testament to time, the message it sends.
